trans-unit.source: Represents a link to an external resource.
The ResXFileRef class is used to include references to files in an XML resource (.resx) file.
A ResXFileRef object represents a link to an external resource in an XML resource (.resx) file.
You add the ResXFileRef object to a .resx file by calling the <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.AddResource%28System.Resources.ResXDataNode%29?displayProperty=fullName> method.
In a data entry in a .resx file, the type is ResXFileRef, and the value is the path location on disk.
When the resource manager deserializes the object, the ResXFileRef performs the I/O to get the file.
The following is an example of a .resx file.

``` <data name="iconclip" type="System.Resources.ResXFileRef, System.Windows.Forms"> <value>lookout.bmp;System.Drawing.Bitmap, System.Drawing</value> </data> <data name="mailbackground" type="System.Resources.ResXFileRef, System.Windows.Forms"> <value>mailbackground.bmp;System.Drawing.Bitmap, System.Drawing</value> </data> <data name="xplogo" type="System.Resources.ResXFileRef, System.Windows.Forms"> <value>xplogo.png;System.Drawing.Bitmap, System.Drawing</value> </data> ``` To add a ResXFileRef object to a .resx file programmatically, you call the <xref:System.Resources.ResXDataNode.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.Resources.ResXFileRef%29?displayProperty=fullName> constructor to instantiate a <xref:System.Resources.ResXDataNode> object.
You then pass this <xref:System.Resources.ResXDataNode> object to the <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.AddResource%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.

When you compile a .resx file with [Resgen.exe (Resource File Generator)](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md), the resources specified in the .resx file are embedded in the resulting document resource file.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Resources.ResXFileRef"></xref> class that references the specified file.
The type referred to by the `typeName` parameter must support a public constructor that accepts a <xref:System.IO.Stream> object as a parameter.
The file to reference.
The type of the resource that is referenced.
fileName or typeName is .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Resources.ResXFileRef"></xref> class that references the specified file.
The type referred to by the `typeName` parameter must support a public constructor that accepts a <xref:System.IO.Stream> object as a parameter.
The file to reference.
The type name of the resource that is referenced.
The encoding used in the referenced file.
Gets the file name specified in the current <xref:System.Resources.ResXFileRef.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
The name of the referenced file.
Gets the encoding specified in the current <xref:System.Resources.ResXFileRef.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
The encoding used in the referenced file.
Gets the text representation of the current <xref href="System.Resources.ResXFileRef"></xref> object.
A string that consists of the concatenated text representations of the parameters specified in the current <xref:System.Resources.ResXFileRef.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Gets the type name specified in the current <xref:System.Resources.ResXFileRef.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
The type name of the resource that is referenced.
